creator: drees76@gmail.com
text:
When building srclib/apr/misc/unix/rand.c uuid_t isn't defined. On this system,
uuid.h is in /usr/include/sys/uuid.h.

Adding #include <sys/uuid.h> gets the build to complete, so perhaps another
check for the location of uuid.h would be appropriate.

Any other details, let me know.

This is fixed in commit 382540 (you can use apr's trunk 1.3 with httpd 2.2,
however, the ASF is likely to continue shipping apr 1.2.x with httpd for 
a while, yet.)  

Please report back that this solves your issue, as we are considering backport 
of commit 382540, 382543, and 382552 to the next 1.2.x version release.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text: Sorry, the base commit is 382541, not 540.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text:
Yes, grabbing a recent apr snapshot and substituting it for the one shipped with
httpd 2.2.0 gets it to build now.
creator: drees76@gmail.com

text:
Backporting the fix, then, to httpd 2.2 as it's been reviewed by yourself
on IRIX, myself on OS/X 10.3 (with a detected libuuid.so binary installed
with a python distribution, which didn't bundle the includes) and by maxb.

Thanks for your report and for testing the patch!
creator: wrowe@apache.org
